entry.title: Application, state and configuration
entry.content:
A lot of time I get pissed off at how application, state and configuration concepts are messed up in applications, and I think it’s high time for a clarification.

What’s part of your application, what’s part of your application’s state and what’s part of your configuration?

Your application should be read-only at runtime, it should read your configuration and read and write the state. There may be exceptions to that rule for the so-called meta-applications that let you configure them when running, nonetheless you should never mix up such concerns.

What should your application contain?

Most likely your application will contain a GUI and a core, it will connect to a data source and/or other external services, and will be deployed on some machine.
